results.title: Double Room for Rent in Colliers Wood
results.overview: A bright and spacious double room in a modern apartment with electric heated flooring, private parking, and ultrafast broadband. The apartment is located in a gated development with CCTV cameras and is close to Colliers Wood tube station.
results.description: Bright spacious double room in Colliers Wood/Mitcham border. CR4 3 For a young working professional/s between age 22-45 years old. - Location - In between Wimbledon and Tooting - on the Northern line so very convenient getting anywhere in London. - Spacious and cosy double room. Very private, only 2 rooms in total in a flat. - Modern ELECTRIC HEATED FLOORING technology in the whole apartment - Very well kept and beautiful gated development with CCTV cameras - Private parking space - Ultrafast broadband - Quiet and very secure Very good location! Walking distance to Colliers Wood tube station (Nothern Line), Phipps Bridge Tram, well connected with plenty of busses. Just a few minutes to Tandem shopping centre, all supermarkets around: Lidl, Aldi, Asda, Sainsburys, M&S, Mitcham town centre, gyms. The area has some of London's best parks (Morden Hall ~ 10min walk) and the nearby food market of Abbey Mills. Single occupancy - ¬£980 p/m all bills included.
results.reliabilityReason: The post provides a detailed description of the room and apartment, includes photos, and has a clear and reasonable price. The poster also provides their contact information, which suggests that they are a genuine landlord.

results.description: Hi! My name is Madi. I know this is a long shot but my housemate is moving out of our Borehamwood flat. Great bus/ train access to London. 15 min bus to edgware or Barnet. Perfect if you are travelling because Luton is on the train line. 10min walk to the nearest shop. We would be sharing the kitchen and living areas. Kitchen/ dining/ living room open plan. Have a washing machine, dryer, fridge/ freezer, dish washer and wall kitchen appliances. I am a 26 y/o Australian teacher and work in the area. I am fun, clean and sociable. I love travelling and going to the gym. Love exploring new places. results.title: Double room for rent in West Hampstead flat
results.overview: A double room is available in a recently refurbished flat in West Hampstead, with a light and airy atmosphere, and a decently sized balcony overlooking a well-maintained garden.
results.description: Double room in West Hampstead flat -1,200 PCM (bills not included) - available now Greetings! We recently moved into this stunning property in West Hampstead and are looking for a third person to join us on a long-term basis. About the property: -Light, recently refurbished first floor apartment with wooden floors on a peaceful (and rather grand) avenue in NW3. -Open plan living area which leads out onto a decently sized balcony overlooking a well maintained garden. -Relatively large, recently refurbished kitchen. -Two full bathrooms and a powder room, so no race for the loo. -Five minute walk to the Heath, 15 to West Hampstead shops, 20 to Hampstead village. About the room (pictured): - 1,200 PCM cold. Not yet sure how much bills will be since we just moved in, but split between three. -Light, double bedroom which overlooks the aforementioned well maintained garden, with built-in wardrobes which have space for drawers and hanging. -Currently unfurnished, but could furnish for the right person. About us: Karina: A 33 year old who loves to travel and explore London! Keeps herself busy going for walks or catching up with friends. Lydia: A 32 year old who enjoys drinking beer, cooking, skiing, running, watching the ruby, and playing her flute (a mythical event which only happens when noone is around). Celeste: Lydia's short sidekick, Celeste, is a long-haired miniature dachshund (pictured) whose hobbies are known to include kissing (much to Karina's distaste), and wagging her tail. Exceptionally loving and relaxed, she makes for exemplary company. YOU: We‚Äôre looking for a third flatmate (of any gender) who is friendly, clean and easygoing. In the ideal world, we would love to live with someone we could call a friend and occasionally share a laugh and a wine (or tea) with - although, we do appreciate that there will be times when you want to close your door on the world and watch Survivor.
results.reliabilityReason: The post includes photos, a detailed description of the property and the room, and information about the current flatmates, which suggests a high level of completeness and transparency, and does not seem to be a scam.
